declarations.comments:
Laws:
- Reflexivity: `x == x = true`
- Symmetry: `x == y = y == x`
- Transitivity: `x == y` and `y == z` implies `x == z`
declarations.title: HasEqual

declarations.comments: Alias for `equal`.

Laws:
- Associativity: `f >> (g >> h) = (f >> g) >> h`
declarations.title: HasCompose

declarations.comments: Alias for `compose`.
Alias for `compose`.

Laws:
- Identity: `f >> identity = identity >> f = f`
declarations.title: HasIdentity

declarations.comments:
Laws:
- Reflexivity: `a <= a`
- Antisymmetry: if `a <= b` and `b <= a` then `a = b`
- Transitivity: if `a <= b` and `b <= c` then `a <= c`
declarations.title: HasCompare

declarations.comments: Alias for `lessThan`.
Alias for `lessThanOrEqualTo`.
Alias for `greaterThan`.
Alias for `greaterThanOrEqualTo`.

Laws:
- Associativity: `x + (y + z) = (x + y) + z`
declarations.title: HasAdd

declarations.comments: Alias for `add`.

Converts a string into an array of characters.

``` purescript
toCharArray "ab"
-- ['a', 'b']
```
declarations.title: toCharArray

declarations.comments:
Converts an array of characters into a string.

``` purescript
fromCharArray ['a', 'b']
-- "ab"
```
declarations.title: fromCharArray

declarations.comments: An alias for `NaN` from JavaScript.
declarations.title: nan

declarations.comments:
Tests whether a number is `nan` or not. This is necessary because `nan`
does not equal `nan`.

``` purescript
isNaN nan
-- true
isNaN 1.0
-- false
```
declarations.title: isNaN

declarations.comments: An alias for `Infinity` from JavaScript.
declarations.title: infinity

declarations.comments:
Tests whether a number is finite or not.

``` purescript
isFinite 1.0
-- true
isFinite infinity
-- false
```
declarations.title: isFinite

declarations.comments:
Rounds a number to the nearest integer.

``` purescript
round 1.4
-- 1
```
declarations.title: round

declarations.comments:
Rounds a number up.

``` purescript
ceiling 1.1
-- 2
```
declarations.title: ceiling

declarations.comments:
Rounds a number down.

``` purescript
floor 1.9
-- 1
```
declarations.title: floor

declarations.comments:
Removes the non-integral component of a number.

``` purescript
truncate 1.5
-- 1
truncate (negate 1.5)
-- negate 1
```
declarations.title: truncate

declarations.comments:
Converts an integer into a number.

``` purescript
toNumber 1
-- 1.0
```
declarations.title: toNumber

declarations.comments:
The constant function. Always returns the first argument.

``` purescript
always 1 2
-- 1
```
declarations.title: always

declarations.comments:
Flips the order of the first two arguments.

``` purescript
flip always 1 2
-- 2
```
declarations.title: flip

declarations.comments:
Applies an argument to a function. This is useful to avoid parentheses.

``` purescript
'A' |> toLower
-- 'a'
```

Applies a function to an argument. This is useful to avoid parentheses.

``` purescript
toLower <| 'A'
-- 'a'
```

Laws:
- `top >= x`
declarations.title: HasTop

declarations.comments:
Laws:
- Identity: `zero + x = x + zero = x`
declarations.title: HasZero

declarations.comments:
Laws:
- Associativity: `x * (y * z) = (x * y) * z`
- Distributivity: `x * (y + z) = (x * y) + (x * z)`
- Annihilation: `x * zero = zero * x = zero`
declarations.title: HasMultiply

declarations.comments: Alias for `multiply`.

Laws:
- Inverse: `a - a = a + (zero - a) = zero`
declarations.title: HasSubtract

declarations.comments: Alias for `subtract`.

Laws:
- `bottom <= x`
declarations.title: HasBottom

declarations.comments:
Laws:
- Associativity: `x && (y && z) = (x && y) && z`
- Commutativity: `x && y = y && x`
- Identity: `x && top = x`
- Annihiliation: `x && bottom = bottom`
- Idempotence: `x && x = x`
declarations.title: HasAnd

declarations.comments: Alias for `and`.

Laws:
- `not top = bottom`
- `not bottom = top`
declarations.title: HasNot

declarations.comments:
Tests whether a number is finite or not.

``` purescript
isInfinite infinity
-- true
isInfinite 1.0
-- false
```
declarations.title: isInfinite

declarations.comments:
Laws:
- Associativity: `x || (y || z) = (x || y) || z`
- Commutativity: `x || y = y || x`
- Identity: `x || bottom = x`
- Annihiliation: `x || top = top`
- Idempotence: `x || x = x`
declarations.title: HasOr

declarations.comments: Alias for `or`.

Laws:
- Identity: `one * x = x * one = x`
declarations.title: HasOne

declarations.comments:
Laws:
- Remainder: `(x / y) * y + (x % y) = x`
- Identity: `x / one = x`
declarations.title: HasDivide

declarations.comments: Alias for `divide`.
Alias for `modulo`.

Laws:
- Identity: `map identity = identity`
- Composition: `map (f >> g) = map f >> map g`
declarations.title: HasMap

declarations.comments: Alias for `map`.

Laws:
- Associativity: `(x <|> y) <|> z == x <|> (y <|> z)`
- Distributivity: `f <$> (x <|> y) == (f <$> x) <|> (f <$> y)`
declarations.title: HasAlternative

declarations.comments: Alias for `alternative`.

Laws:
- Associative composition: `(<<) <$> f <*> g <*> h = f <*> (g <*> h)`
declarations.title: HasApply

declarations.comments: Alias for `apply`.

Laws:
- Identity: `(pure id) <*> v = v`
- Composition: `(pure <<) <*> f <*> g <*> h = f <*> (g <*> h)`
- Homomorphism: `(pure f) <*> (pure x) = pure (f x)`
- Interchange: `u <*> (pure y) = (pure (\ f -> f y)) <*> u`
declarations.title: HasPure

declarations.comments:
Laws:
- Associativity: `(x >>= f) >>= g = x >>= (\ k => f k >>= g)`
declarations.title: HasBind

declarations.comments: Alias for `bind`.
Alias for `bind`.

Laws:
- `lift (pure x) = pure x`
- `lift (m >>= \ x -> y) = lift m >>= \ x -> lift y`
declarations.title: HasLift

declarations.comments:
Laws:
- Left identity: `empty <|> x == x`
- Right identity: `x <|> empty == x`
- Annihilation: `f <$> empty == empty`
declarations.title: HasEmpty

declarations.comments:
Laws:
- `do { getState ; getState } = getState`
- `do { setState x ; setState y } = setState y`
- `do { setState x ; getState } = setState x $> x`
- `do { s <- getState ; setState s } = pure unit`
declarations.title: HasState

declarations.comments:
Laws:
- `pred bottom = Nothing`
- `succ top = Nothing`
- `toEnum (fromEnum x) = Just x`
- `compare x y = compare (fromEnum x) (fromEnum y)`
declarations.title: IsEnumerable

declarations.comments:
Convert a character to lower case.

``` purescript
toLower 'A'
-- 'a'
```
declarations.title: toLower

declarations.comments:
Convert a character to upper case.

``` purescript
toUpper 'a'
-- 'A'
```
declarations.title: toUpper

declarations.comments:
An alias for `true`. This is useful in guard clauses.

``` purescript
max x y
  | y > x = y
  | otherwise = x
```
declarations.title: otherwise

declarations.comments:
A functional alternative to the `if _ then _ else _` syntax. This is
useful in higher-order functions.

``` purescript
map (boolean 1 2) [false, true]
-- [2, 1]
```
declarations.title: boolean

declarations.comments:
Represents native effects. This type constructor takes two arguments: a
row of effects and a return type. The row of effects gives the native
capabilities of the effect.

``` purescript
-- This effect can use the console (like `console.log()` in JavaScript).
forall e. Effect (console :: CONSOLE | e) Unit
```
declarations.title: Effect

declarations.comments:
Runs a pure effect.

``` purescript
runPure (pure 1)
-- 1
```
declarations.title: runPure

declarations.comments:
Dangerously runs an effect. In general, you should not use this function.
Sometimes it is necessary to subvert the type system. This can also be
useful for debugging pure functions.

``` purescript
unsafeRunEffect (log "..." *> pure 1) :: Int
-- logs "..." and returns `1`
```
declarations.title: unsafeRunEffect

declarations.comments: Represents effects that can throw exceptions.
declarations.title: EXCEPTION

declarations.comments: An alias for `Error` from JavaScript.
declarations.title: Exception

declarations.comments:
Creates an exception with the given message.

``` purescript
show (exception "Boink!")
-- "Error: Boink!"
```
declarations.title: exception

declarations.comments:
Throws an exception.

``` purescript
throw (exception "Boink!")
```
declarations.title: throw

declarations.comments:
Catches an exception.

``` purescript
catch
  (throw (exception "Boink!"))
  (\ e -> error (show e))
--
```
declarations.title: catch

declarations.comments: Represents effects that can generate random numbers.
declarations.title: RANDOM

declarations.comments:
Generates a random number. The number will be in the range [0, 1). That
is, `0 <= x < 1`.

``` purescript
randomNumber
-- 0.123
```
declarations.title: randomNumber

declarations.comments: Represents effects that can write to the console.
declarations.title: CONSOLE

declarations.comments:
Writes an info-level message to the console.

``` purescript
info "Starting..."
-- prints "Starting..." to STDOUT
```
declarations.title: info

declarations.comments:
Writes a log-level message to the console.

``` purescript
log "Listening.."
-- prints "Listening..." to STDOUT
```
declarations.title: log

declarations.comments:
Writes a warn-level message to the console.

``` purescript
warn "Stopping..."
-- prints "Stopping..." to STDERR
```
declarations.title: warn

declarations.comments:
Writes an error-level message to the console.

``` purescript
error "Exploded!"
-- prints "Exploded!" to STDERR
```
declarations.title: error

declarations.comments:
Converts a value to a string and writes a log-level message to the
console.

``` purescript
print 1
-- print "1" to STDOUT
```
declarations.title: print
